Class FilterN<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Filter<T>
      • FilterN<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericFilter<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AveragingFilterN, CompareFilterN

    public abstract class FilterN<T>
extends Filter<T>
    FilterN is an abstract class that extends Filter. It initializes an NBuffer which will store the last N inputs.
    Author:
    gmh73

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterN

        public FilterN(int n)
        Sets the FilterN to size n. The filter will remember n inputs.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of inputs the filter will remember

    • Method Detail

      • checkN

        protected final void checkN(int n)
        Checks if n is valid, ie >= 1
        Parameters:
        n -

      • reset

        public void reset(T r)
        Resets the previous output to r and sets the inputs since a new output to 0. So, if a child class relies on inputsSinceNewOutput to decide whether or not to update an output, it will not search its memory for at least N inputs.
        Specified by:
        reset in class Filter<T>
